PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will also adopt a mix of policies to support coordinated regional development and guide financial institutions When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: towards this end, measures would be taken to further improve the effectiveness of the transmission mechanism of monetary policy, optimize credit structure, bolster the financial support for weak links such as agriculture, farmers and the rural areas and small- and medium-sized enterprises, develop consumer credit, support independent innovation, merger and acquisition, industrial relocation and coordinated regional development.\n                "}]

supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: in the meantime, efforts will be made to integrate reform measures into macroeconomic regulation, and enhance the efficiency of financial sector operation and its ability to serve the real economy.\n                "}]

"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence focuses on enhancing the efficiency of financial sector operation and its ability to serve the real economy, which is a neutral stance, as it does not indicate any specific direction or bias in monetary policy."
}

Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the monetary policy committee of the people’s bank of china held its 2nd quarterly meeting a few days ago in beijing.\n                "}]

"label": "irrelevant",
"justification": "The sentence only reports on the meeting of the monetary policy committee without providing any information related to monetary policy decisions or actions."
}

supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will work to improve the market-based\xa0mechanism\xa0of interest rate formation and transmission\xa0and the\xa0central bank policy rate system.\n                "}]

"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence focuses on improving the market-based mechanism of interest rate formation and transmission, which is a neutral stance, as it doesn't indicate a change in interest rates."

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc\xa0will enhance\xa0market-oriented interest rate formation and transmission mechanism by improving the central bank policy rate system, optimize regulation over deposit rates, constantly unleash the potential of the lpr reform and further bring down\xa0actual loan rates.\n                "}]

Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the participants were of the view that that performance of china's real economy and financial sector as steady with a of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc, in line with the overall arrangement of the state council, implemented a relatively loose monetary policy and strengthened financial support for economic growth.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence indicates that the PBC implemented a relatively loose monetary policy, which suggests an expansionary stance, hence dovish."

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the meeting pointed out that the economy performed stable in the first quarter by keeping the sustained and rapid development momentum.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence indicates that the economy is performing stably and maintaining rapid development momentum, which suggests a positive outlook and a lack of concern about inflation or other economic risks, characteristic of a dovish stance."
}

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: financial reform and innovation should be pressed ahead to improve the competitiveness of financial institutions and the efficiency of the financial markets in resources allocation, and to streamline the transmission mechanism for the conduct of moderately loose monetary policy.\n                "}]

increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the structural monetary policy tools will be effectively\xa0leveraged for accurate liquidity provision to strengthen “direct reach” of policies.\n                "}]
2025-05-04 01:28:04,369 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence implies that the PBoC will provide accurate liquidity to strengthen the 'direct reach' of policies, which suggests an accommodative stance."
}

financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: work will be done to implement financial policy measures to promote the healthy development of the platform economy.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it is their concensus view\xa0that the chinese economy has maintained\xa0a stable growth momentum with strong resilience, the overall supply and demand remains broadly balanced, and the swtich to new growth drivers has gathered pace.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: remaining generally stable, the rmb exchange rate has moved in both directions with greater flexibility and played a role as\xa0stabilizer for the\xa0macroeconomy.\n                "}]

to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pboc will improve the market-oriented interest rate formation and transmission mechanism and optimize the central bank policy rate system.\n                "}]
2025-05-04 01:28:23,099 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence is neutral as it focuses on improving the interest rate formation and transmission mechanism, without indicating a change in interest rates."
}

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: liquidity was adequate in the banking system, growth of money and credit supply rapid and the financial system operated in a stable manner.\n                "}]

of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc will act in accordance with the decisions and arrangements made by the cpc central committee and the state council, uphold the general principle of pursuing progress while ensuring stability, and place an utmost priority on\xa0stability.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: while ensuring continuity and stability at aggregate level, preemptive andfine-tuning measures should be strengthened.\n                "}]

"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence emphasizes the need for continuity and stability, indicating a neutral stance, as it does not suggest any significant changes to monetary policy."

namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: measures should be taken to actively advance industrial andinternational trade restructuring, promote the equilibrium of the bop, fosterthe transformation of economic growth pattern, and improve the efficiency ofeconomic growth.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence promotes measures to improve economic growth, which indicates a focus on stimulating the economy, characteristic of a dovish stance."
}

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pbc has continued to implement the sound monetary policy while the commercial banks gradually established and improved their incentive and restraint mechanisms to promote loan marketing, resulting in acceleration of the growth of monetary credit and strengthening of financial support to economic development.\n                "}]

Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the monetary policy committee of the pbc held the 3rdquarterly meeting of 2005 in beijing days ago.\n may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the monetary policy committee of the pbc held the 2ndquarterly meeting of 2004 in beijing on june 18th.\n                "}]

namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: while the sound monetary policy stance is maintained, a mix of policy instruments should be flexibly used to appropriately adjust money supply on a timely basis.\n                "}]

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: balance of international payments will be enhanced and the rmb exchangerate will be maintained basically stable at an adaptive and equilibrium level.\n                "}]

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the
